Package alston.minecraft

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Clickable
    States that the Object that implements this has a click method.
    Showable
    States that the Object that implements this can open a window and must implement a close() method.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Block
    Used to represent the smallest unit of 3D mesurement in the Game, the equivilent of a voxel (volume-pixel), each mesuring exactly 1m*1m*1m.
    BlockFactory
    A factory that's sole purpose is to create a Block, or a subtype of it given a type.
    BlockItem
    An extension the abstract class Item, and is for any Items that will become a block when right clicked.
    Chunk
    Holds an array of Blocks and is and handles all initializations of Blocks and find the Blocks they hold.
    CraftingTable
    A Clickable Block that can show a Window (Showable) to craft Items.
    EmptyItem
    Represents an empty/no Item or slot (Null Object Pattern).
    Game
    Contains all game variables and handles initialization of a few of the Objects.
    HealthBar
    Represents the visual health bar and contains all interactions with the Player's health.
    Inventory
    Contains all the Items the player currently has in their inventory, and is the handles all interactions between the UI and the inventory, including (but not limited to) handing the visual functions, changing the Items in it, ect.
    InventoryBar
    Contains all the Pictures for the Inventory Bar GUI.
    Item
    A generalization of all the types of Items stacks, and holds all essential variables and handles interactions that occurs between them.
    Light
    A Object representation of a Point-Source Light, which propergates from the origin with a decay to the surrounding adjacent Blocks with a decay.
    Main
    The main class and therefore entry point, and serves the purpose of containing the majority of the static variables and Object prototypes (Prototype design pattern) that are the same and will not change for all instances of Game, as well as constants, useful refrences (such as to the main thread), and all initiations for those variables/prototypes.
    Mob
    Represents the generalizaion of all the hostile NPCs.
    Player
    This class contains the attributes of the representation of the user and provides an easy container for Serialization.
    RecipeMap<T extends java.lang.Comparable>
    Used as a generic data structure for any recipies, which requires an array of type T extends Comparable, which maps to a single type T and the Class of U, a type that represents nothing.
    SimpleItem
    Objects of this class represents Items that have no special features, and do not become Blocks.
    SlotArea
    Abstract representation of a sqauare area in the GUI that contains slots for Items and handles all interactions with them.
    Sunlight
    A Sunlight as defined by this class proporgates light from the top to bottom of every X/Z components in the 3D Vector Space, and will put a Light on the Block that it hits.
    Tool
    Contains both the Item aspect of tools and the Spatials for a 3D representation.
    Torch
    An Object of this class represents a torch: A Block that does not naturally spawn (must be crafted).
    TorchItem
    An Item that will have a special Spatial and physics Control (is NOT a Block-shaped item).
    Utility
    Class that contains utility functions that can be applicable in multiple situations, or is to be used by multiple classes.
    Window
    Contains all the basic functions of any pop-up window, including interactions with the mouse such as Item manipulation.
    Zombie
    A type of mob that is melee and will walk towards the Player if it is near and attack him if he is near.
